main event: The observer sighted a reddish glow of an object that resembled Venus, believed to be a satellite decay, at 12:00 on January 24, 1963.
interesting points: The observed object had a cherry red tail that lengthened as it moved Northeast., The sighting lasted for approximately 2 minutes and 30 seconds to 3 minutes., The object emitted a glow and was observed to disintegrate., The weather during the sighting was clear with good visibility., The observation was done using the naked eye.
sighted object: a reddish glowing object with a tail
witness description: male, white, approximately 5'-7" tall with white to grayish hair
